page.title: 15NOAK HILL VILLAGE
page.content: {Noak Hill Village}was once an isolated village to the N.W. of Romford. Employment for most of the villagers was in farming, particularly for the{Neave family}on the{Dagnam {Park Estate.}Today the village is dominated by the{Harold Hill}housing estate built after the Second World War. The village does have a number of buildings listed as of special architectural or historical interest:- Building Date {ST. THOMAS'S CHURCH }1841-2 {Orchard Cottages} C18th {Rose Cottages} C19th {Holly Tree Cottages} late C18th {Meadow Cottages} mid C19th {Old Keepers Cottage} C19th {Thatched Cottage} early C19th {Angel Cottages} early C15th
